questions.question: In the typical digital IC design flow, what is the primary role of a 'synthesizer' tool?
options: Translating RTL code into a gate-level netlist.
Verifying the functionality of the circuit using test vectors.
Placing and routing physical cells on the silicon.
Generating the final GDSII file for fabrication.
Simulating the analog characteristics of the transistors.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a cache memory in a computer system?
options: To provide non-volatile storage for permanent data.
To increase the total storage capacity of the system.
To reduce the average memory access time by storing frequently used data closer to the CPU.
To manage virtual memory translations and page tables.
To execute arithmetic and logical operations quickly.

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using a formal verification approach over extensive simulation for digital circuit validation?
options: Formal verification is significantly faster to set up and run for large designs.
It can prove the absence of design errors for all possible inputs and states, rather than just observed ones.
It provides more accurate timing analysis than static timing analysis (STA).
It is primarily used for validating analog and mixed-signal components.
Formal verification tools automatically generate optimal testbenches.

questions.question: Which of the following techniques primarily leverages the principle of *temporal locality* and *spatial locality* to improve memory system performance?
options: Register Renaming in out-of-order execution.
Branch Prediction using a Branch Target Buffer (BTB).
Data Caching between the CPU and main memory.
Virtual Memory using a Translation Lookaside Buffer (TLB).
Multithreading for parallel execution.

questions.question: In the context of chip layout and fabrication, what is the primary purpose of 'design rules' (e.g., minimum width, minimum spacing)?
options: To ensure the chip operates at the desired clock frequency.
To define the logical behavior of the digital gates.
To ensure the manufacturability and electrical reliability of the integrated circuit.
To optimize the power consumption of the design.
To specify the programming language for hardware description.
